CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 16, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "Backs Words With Action - James Betts, left, an active member of the Youth Division of the Pittsburgh NAACP, explains to a passer-by his reasons for picketing a downtown shoe store which has no Negroes in sales positions. The sign he carries reads: "Help 'Mr. K' in Washington.  Hurt 'Mr. K' in Moscow.  Don't Buy Jim Crow Practices!" - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Protesters outside Quality Shoes, including James Betts, holding sign reading "Youth division NAACP Help Mr. 'K' in Wash. DC, Hurt Mr. 'K' in Moscow, Don't buy Jim Crow practices"
